greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Characteristic function for nondeficient numbers (A023196): a(n) = 1 if A001065(n) >= n, 0 otherwise.
comment: Differs from A210455 for the first time at n=70, and after that at n=836, 4030, 5830, 7192, 7912, 9272, etc., that is, at weird numbers, A006037.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
Index entries for sequences related to sums of divisors
example: The proper divisors of 6 are 1, 2 and 3, and their sum is 6, and because 6 >= 6, a(6) = 1.
The proper divisors of 70 are 1, 2, 5, 7, 10, 14, and 35, and their sum is 74, and because 74 >= 70, a(70) = 1.
xref: Cf. A023196 (positions of ones), A005100 (of zeros).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 12 2017
